item.value: The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world. There are also more than 7,000 dialects. A dialect is a regional language variation with different pronunciation, vocabulary, or meaning.
Most people blink about 17,000 times a day.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. Mature blue whales can measure anywhere from 75 feet (23 m) to 100 feet (30.5 m) long and can weigh as much as 150 tons.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.

On 12 April 1961 Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin, a Soviet cosmonaut , became the first human in outer space and the first to orbit the Earth. He became a hero of the Soviet Union for his pioneering tour in space.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
Steve Wozniak designed the first Apple computer in 1976. It was known as the Apple I.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system.
Tides are caused by the rotation of the Earth and the gravitational effects of the Moon and Sun.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world.
In 1972 Ray Tomlinson at BBN developed the first e-mail program. In his first email to himself, he uses the @ sign. This was the first time it appeared in an e-mail address.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The Sun is one of about 200 billion stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The most current estimates guess that there are 100 to 200 billion galaxies in the Universe
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
